articles.description: Arsenal, Liverpool, Manchester City and Tottenham extend their unbeaten starts to five games in the Premier League, plus Champions League build-up.
articles.title: Premier League reaction after weekend of late wins

articles.description: The ball ricocheting off Joe Marler's head turned England's game against Japan, but reading much more into it is a tricky business.
articles.title: Truth hard to find in England's inkblot Test

articles.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says replacing goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale with David Raya is the same as swapping outfield players.
articles.title: Arteta plays down replacing Ramsdale with Raya

articles.description: The Denver Broncos pull off a "Hail Mary" play alongside the rest of the NFL plays of the week from the second round of games.
articles.title: Denver pull off 'Hail Mary' in NFL plays of the week

articles.description: Joe Root will play in England's first one-day international against Ireland at Headingley in a bid to improve his form before the World Cup.
articles.title: Root to play in first one-dayer against Ireland

articles.description: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland and Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp star in the weekend's funniest moments from Match of the Day 2's '2 Good 2 Bad'.
articles.title: Haaland & Klopp star in weekend's funniest moments

articles.description: Ethiopia's Gudaf Tsegay and Sweden's Armand Duplantis set world records as the Diamond League final concluded in Eugene, Oregon, on Sunday.
articles.title: Tsegay & Duplantis set world records in Diamond League final

articles.description: Leicestershire's One-Day Cup hero Harry Swindells says he was looking for a new job before he got called up for Saturday's showdown.
articles.title: Leics hero Swindells was job hunting before final

articles.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan says he never keeps the trophy after winning a fourth straight Shanghai Masters title with an 11-9 win over Luca Brecel.
articles.title: O'Sullivan to give trophy away after Shanghai win

articles.description: Patrick Mahomes wins on his birthday as the Kansas City Chiefs bounce back with a win while the Dallas Cowboys' defence dominated again and the Cincinnati Bengals slipped to 0-2.
articles.title: Mahomes made to work & Dallas defence dominates again
